result.title: Objective
result.description: Objective: To expand, and ensure effective management of, the protected area network to safeguard threatened biodiversity

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. Coverage (ha) of the terrestrial formal protected area network of mainland Mauritius and the islets:

baseline.comment:
State protected areas
8,027ha
Private protected areas
0ha

target.comment:
State protected areas
11,700ha
Private protected areas
3,220ha

actual.comment:
The status quo in terms of protected areas has been maintained.
State Protected areas = 8,328 ha
Private protected areas = 0 ha
For Bassin Blanc, acquisition under appeal in valuation tribunal is still not finalized.
The management plans for the Bras d'Eau National Park and Black River Gorges National Park have been submitted during this reporting period.Both document proposes the creation of buffer zones , these will be delineated in the mapping under the Protected Area Network Expansion Strategy. Yet, the whole process of declaring the land around the parks must be initiated by the Ministry of Housing and Lands which is the local authority to define the land uses.
Regarding Mountain and River Reserves which covers approximately 6500 ha of privately managed land , their status as protected areas is still unclear. The Protected Area Network Expansion Strategy , expected for September 2015, will provide the underpinnings for adding these reserves and other potential reserves such as the corridor of 4000 metres linking Le Morne to the Black River Gorges National Park, to the protected area networks.
Concerning the Native Terrestrial Biodiversity and National Parks Bill, which makes provision for proclamation of of private reserves, is expected to be presented to the parliament in October 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description:
2. Total operational budget (including HR and capital budget) allocation (US$) for protected area management
[Note added to clarify that this indicator refers to the annual budget]

target.comment: More than US$4.1m

actual.comment: Target can be considered as being achieved. The total budget for PA's as Government budget allocation 2014 is estimated to be $ 6.2 m for the Forestry services and $ 2.4 m ( include funds from PAN project, approximately $800,000) for the National Parks and Conservation services. Additional funds of ~ US $0.25 m from National Parks and conservation funds has been used for Protected Areas. Other financing mechanism are also now in place such a Maurice Ile Durable (MID) fund to the tune of~ US $ 0 .4 m, for Protected Areas management. Moreover funds from private companies Corporate Social Responsibility ( CSR) have also been allocated as follows: HSBC= US $ 25,000 IBL= US $ 2,500 , Lions clubs = US $ 8,500. Total budget amounts to US $9.25 m

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3. Financial sustainability score (%) for national systems of protected areas

baseline.comment: Baseline application of the of the Financial Sustainability Scorecard (2009) yielded a general score of 17%

target.comment:
Application of the of the Financial Sustainability Scorecard at project end is expected to yield a general score 30-40%
[Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report]

actual.comment: Target achieved. Financial Scorecard has not been re-worked for this reporting period Initiatives undertaken in 2013 and 2014 to improve the financial score of the PAs are still ongoing . Private companies are still directly contributing to PAs management in terms of ecosystem restoration and IAS removal activities in the PAs. The lions club , a service group, is channeling CSR funds from private companies for IAS clearing and forest restoration activities. The Maurice Ile Durable has continued to fund PA management and Ecosystem restoration in newly identified areas. There will soon be another source of funds from the European Union. The Indian Ocean Commission (IOC) have called for proposal for local biodiversity project to the tune of US $ 36 000 to US $ 90 000 per project.Deadline for submission of Project is August 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 4. Capacity development indicator score (%) for protected area system:

target.comment:
Systemic 78%
Institutional 60%
Individual 75%
[Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report]

actual.comment:
The Scorecard has not been applied again. Hence, it is not possible to inform the indicator. The Capacity development indicator will be calculated after the training programme has been finalized. The score generated will serve as a baseline. The Capacity Development indicator will be generated a second time after training completed and the outcome will be measure against the baseline.
Concerning the training need analysis, the exercise is nearly completed and data analysis should start soon.
Otherwise , an ecological restoration workshop to share good eco-system restoration practice through the development of a practitioners' guide/manual , is planned for September/October 2015.
Regarding actual training carried out during this reporting period, there has been two training sessions in December 2014 on the use of GPS. Staff from the Forestry services , NPCS and Ministry of Housing and Lands attended the training.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description:
5a. METT (Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool) scores for different categories of formal protected areas on mainland Mauritius and the islets
- Conservation Management Areas within the Black River Gorges National Park

baseline.comment:
METT Scores for Conservation Management Areas within the Black River Gorges National Park are btw 51% - 64%
[Original METT B1-B8 :]
Brise Fer 62.8%
Fixon (Bel Ombre) 64.1%
Florin 62.8%
Le PÃ©trin 62.8%
MacchabÃ© 62.8%
Mare Longue 62.8%
Montagne Cocotte 61.5%
Morne SÃ¨che 50.6%
During the project preparation phase there was comprehensive application of the METT methodology across the entire PAN, with the exception of forest reserves. This note applies for all other sub-indicators under indicator 5.

target.comment: METT Score is more than 70% for conservation management areas

actual.comment: The METT Scores have not been worked out for this reporting period.Cleared and restored areas have indeed expanded but will not have a major impact on the scores. Though the METT is to re-calculated at the end of the project, the scores will be calculated again in 2016 by the CTA and PMU . The latter will then update the METT on a regular basis and use this as a Monitoring and Evaluation tool.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description:
5b. METT scores for different categories of formal protected areas on mainland Mauritius and the islets
- Rivulet Terre Rouge Estuary Bird Sanctuary (RTREBS)

baseline.comment:
METT Score is 57.1%
[Original METT B10]
RTREBS

target.comment: METT Score is more than 65% for the RTREBS

actual.comment: Status Quo maintained. Drafting of management plan for RTREBS is planned to be completed in 2015 under the funding of Agence Francaise De Developpement. This will upgrade the METT scores.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description:
5c. METT scores for different categories of formal protected areas on mainland Mauritius and the islets
- Mountain Reserves
- Nature Reserves

baseline.comment:
METT Scores for both Mountain Reserves and Nature Reserves are btw 37% - 65%
[Original METT A7-A8 for Mountain Reserves :]
Le Morne
Corps de Garde
Le Pouce
[Original METT A1-A6 for Nature Reserves :]
Bois Sec 37.3%
Bras dâ€™Eau 51.2%
Cabinet 46.7%
Gouly PÃ¨re 38.7%
Les Mares 38.7%
Perrier 65.3%

target.comment: METT Score is more than 60% for different Mountain Reserves and Nature Reserves

actual.comment: Status Quo maintained. METT scores will evolved depending whether mountain reserves are officially declared protected areas.The expected PANES will provide the underpinnings for designating mountain reserves as protected areas.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description:
5d. Indicator dropped
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014]
MTR recommended to remove from the logframe the METT indicator related to forest reserves.
Original formulation was:
METT scores for different categories of formal protected areas on mainland Mauritius and the islets
Forest Reserves

baseline.comment:
Indicator dropped
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014]
MTR recommended to remove from the logframe the METT indicator related to forest reserves.
Original formulation was:
Not yet assessed. Assumed ~37% or less
To be defined in 2012

target.comment:
Indicator dropped
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014]
MTR recommended to remove from the logframe the METT indicator related to forest reserves.
Original formulation was:
Probably to be set ~55%
To be defined in 2012.

actual.comment: Indicator dropped .

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Outcome 1) Systemic framework for PA expansion improved

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
6. Number of â€˜Land Typesâ€™ included in the PAN
The following 16 land types have been classified for the mainland:
- Central intermediate lava plateau
- Central late lava plateau
- Chamarel inter-mountain valley flat & slopes
- Eastern coastal valley flats & slopes
- Late lava plains & inland slopes
- Lower mountain slopes
- NE, E & southern intermediate lava plains & slopes
- NW intermediate lava plains & slopes
- Riverine lands
- Sand beaches & dunes
- Western coastal valleys, plains & slopes
- Central uplands early lava plains & slopes
- Inland water body
- Old volcanic mountain & gorges
- Coastal salt marshes
- Lakes

baseline.comment:
8 of 16
(Refer to Table 2 of Technical Report IV:
Overview of the forests and terrestrial protected area network
for more information on Baseline and Targets.)

target.comment:
12 of 16
(Refer to Table 2 of Technical Report IV:
Overview of the forests and terrestrial protected area network
for more information on Baseline and Targets.)

actual.comment: Target achieved and slightly surpassed. All existing land types (geological types) under forest cover in Mauritius covered.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 7. Ecological corridors and marine-terrestrial linkages incorporated into the PAN

target.comment: 2 (1 in South; 1 in North)

actual.comment: Target not yet achieved but additional progress made towards. The international team of consultants, EcoAfrica, is actively working on Protected Areas Mapping with GIS data from Ministry of Housing and Lands and GeoTerra with resolution up to 50 cm. These Mappings will then serve to visualize the potential linkages and corridors.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 8. Number of rare and threatened plant species (of 231 with a known distribution) having at least 1 wild population represented in the PAN.

baseline.comment:
Previously considered extinct 2
Extirpated in the wild 1
Critically endangered 44
Endangered 25
Vulnerable 62

target.comment:
Previously considered extinct 6
Extirpated in the wild 2
Critically endangered 70
Endangered 33
Vulnerable 71 ide e

actual.comment: Target achieved . No change since last year. An update status should be produced by the end of 2015 as the Red list specialist group of Mauritius is updating the red list status for flora.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description:
9. Reach of the communications and awareness programme as follows:
9a) Percentage of those participating in experiential learning programmes instigated by the PAN who show enhanced knowledge
9b) Percentage of those participating in experiential learning programmes instigated by the PAN who show positive changes in behavior.
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014:]
Indicator #9 has been revised as a result of the MTR. It was not being properly informed in previous reporting periods anyway.
It was previously formulated as follows:
â€œReach (estimated number of people) of the communications and awareness programmeâ€
The MTR recommended this changed. The response was:
Reach indicator does not tell us anything about the take-up of messages. This indicator will be improved. It will be based upon surveys of target audiences and these groups will be surveyed for changes in their knowledge, attitudes and practices regarding general issues of biodiversity conservation in Mauritius and specific project protected area network objectives.
Training indicators have been revised to be outcome-oriented.

baseline.comment:
In order to adequately assess the target, now as a % of those reached out by the project, tailored surveys will need to be applied.
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014:]
The baseline for indicator #9 It was previously formulated as follows:
â€œBroad-based communications (estimated number of audience receiving different media message) t.b.d.
Outreach programmes (number of people attending) t.b.d.
Experiential learning programmes (number of people attending) t.b.d.
Lobbying of key decision-makers (number of people and institutions) t.b.d.â€

target.comment:
9a) : At least 80% of those participating in experiential learning programmes show enhanced knowledge and attitude
9b) At least 50% of those participating in experiential learning programmes show positive changes in behavior.
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014:]
Target for indicator #9 It was previously formulated as follows:
â€œBroad-based communications (estimated number of audience receiving different media message) approx. 100,000.
Outreach programmes (number of people attending) approx. 500.
Experiential learning programmes (number of people attending) approx. 500.
Lobbying of key decision-makers (number of people and institutions) 10 of 4.â€

actual.comment:
Further progress have been made towards the target. Since the facebook page has been created in July 2014 , the number of likes has add up to 960 . The awareness campaign is still being implemented with future experiential events coming. A National art competition on the theme of world biodiversity was launched on the 8th May 2015 and all entries had to be submitted on the 18th May 2015. The PMU is going to do a thorough analysis of the exercise and its output to create a baseline.Results from future competition will be compared to the baseline to find out whether there has been changes.
In addition, a national survey will be undertaken at the close of the awareness programme to look at changes in knowledge and behaviour.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 10. Number of strategic plans prepared for PA institutions that are linked to the MTEF

target.comment:
3
[Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report]

actual.comment:
There has been tangible progress towards this target.The review of the Bras d'Eau National Park Management plan has been fully reviewed and will soon go for public consultation process. Review of the Bras D'Eau operational plan has been completed in June 2015 and comments have been communicated to the International Team of Consultants for amendments.
Regarding the Black River Gorges National Park9BRGNP) Management plan, a first draft was submitted on the 16th February 2015. An amended version together with the annual operation plan (AOP) was submitted in June 2015 after comments were communicated. The PMU is actually driving the review of the BRGNP AOP.
Concerning the strategic planning, there has been continuous consultation with FS and NPCS during the different EcoAfrica missions .The submission of the strategic planning should follow the PANES.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description:
11. Income from other sources (i.e. non- state budget allocation) converted to USD (to counteract the effect of inflation on the local currency) the and as part of the total budget of the PAN the Financial Scorecard can be used to track the indicator as the difference between items #1 and #5 in the Scorecard
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014:]
Indicator #11 has been revised as a result of the MTR. It was not being properly informed in previous reporting periods anyway.
It was previously formulated as follows:
â€œIncome from other sources (i.e. non- state budget allocation), as a percentage of the total operational budget of the PAN.â€

baseline.comment:
Difference between 5 and 1 in the Financial Scorecard:
At the baseline: $2.1 million
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014:]
Indicator #11 has been revised as a result of the MTR.
Its baseline was previously formulated as follows:
â€œApprox. 33%â€
Calculus Aide Memoire for baseline:
(Item 1) Total annual central government budget allocated to PA management (excluding donor funds and revenues generated for the PA system)
At the baseline: $5.8 million
(Item 5) Total finances available to the PA system [line item 1+2.A+2.B]+ [line item 3 * line item 4]
At the baseline: $7.9 million

target.comment:
Difference between 5 and 1 in the Financial Scorecard: At least $4.0 million by project end
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014:]
Indicator #11 has been revised as a result of the MTR.
Its target was previously formulated as follows:
â€œAt least 54%â€

actual.comment: Approaching the target. Income from other sources for this reporting period adds up to US $ 1,330,000.00. Out of it, US $ 930,000 represents income to the NPCS from non-governmental sources , US $ 400,000 comes from Maurice Ile Durable Fund and the rest is CSR funds. However , it must be notified that the available fund of $ 930,000 has not yet been used.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description:
12. Number of tourism concessions awarded
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVION 2014]
In the MTR, the baseline has been amended to 2 and the target amended to 3.

target.comment:
3
[was originally 1]

actual.comment: Target not yet achieved. There has been important progress towards it. A tourism working group has been set up in September 2014 under the impulse of the International Team of Consultants. The main objective of this platform is to discuss the creation of the nature based tourism association and to put a structure in place that will assist to obtain and manage concessions.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 13. Number of private landowners concluding stewardship agreements:

baseline.comment:
Informal, non-binding, agreements 0
Formal, legally binding, agreements 0

target.comment:
Informal, non-binding, agreements more than 6
Formal, legally binding, agreements more than 2

actual.comment:
Target not yet achieved. The international team of consultants has submitted a first discussion paper on Conservation stewardship in April 2015 for review and comments.
The Ministry has approved the 7 Memorandun of Understanding between the private forest owners for IAS clearing and forest restoration on private lands in September 2014, The first installment was paid in January 2015. The National steering committee on the 28th May 2015 has approved to the request to increase the number of MOUs as IAS clearing is more cost effective under this scheme.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: 14. Number of planning support and operational PA staff completing specialised training and/or skills development programs

baseline.comment:
a) Short course training 0
b) Mentoring programme 0
c) Train-the-trainers programme 0
d) IAS and ecosystem restoration skills development 0
e) Partnering agreements with counterpart institutions 0

target.comment:
a) Short course training more than 40
b) Mentoring programme 5
c) Train-the-trainers programme 5
d) IAS and ecosystem restoration skills development 50
e) Partnering agreements with counterpart institutions more than 4
[Target adjusted for the last sub-indicator after conclusion of inception report]

actual.comment:
For this reporting period, there has not been much improvement with respect to 2013 reporting.
14a) Short Training Course: There has been two training sessions on the use of GPS . 15 staff members from the forestry service, National Park and Conservation Services and Ministry of Housing and lands were trained.
14b) Approaching and reaching 3, when target is 5 Mentoring programme:29 Parks Rangers ,Assistant Park Rangers, Forest Enforcement and Conservation Officer
14c) Approaching and reaching 3, when target is 5 Train-the-trainers programme :16 Park Rangers and Assistant Park Rangers .
14d) IAS and ecosystem restoration skills development, 43 manual workers, 4 Park Rangers 12 Assistant Parks Rangers, 10 Forest Officers are regularly trained on IAS removal and native forest restoration.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Outcome 3. Operational know-how in place to contain threats

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 15. Number of protected areas with updated and approved management plans

target.comment: 3 or more

actual.comment: Approaching the target. Much progress has been achieved with the submission of Draft management plans for the Bras d'Eau National parks in 2014 and the Black River Gorges National Parks in February 2015. The Former will soon go for a 2 months public review while the amended BRGNP management plan has just been submitted. For RTREBS , the drafting of the management plan should be completed by the end of 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 16. Extent of area (ha) under active IAS management and ecosystem restoration

target.comment:
500 ha
[Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report]

actual.comment: Progress: More than 70% of target achieved. The area under conservation management area with active IAS management and ecosystem restoration achieved during this reporting period has increased to 369.18 ha -- that is 73.8 % of the target has been achieved. Maintenance weeding has already been carried out in 67.25 ha of native forests.A total of 21105 seedlings have been planted to June 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 17. Average cost (US$/ha) of IAS control and ecosystem restoration

baseline.comment:
17a) Initial clearing and first follow-up US$9,000
17b) Subsequent follow-ups US$1,000

target.comment:
17a) Initial clearing and first follow-up US$3,000
17b) Subsequent follow-ups US$700
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION - 2014:]
Target had adjusted for the first sub-indicator after conclusion of inception report, but the MTR recommended it that this target should be revised upward again.
It was $2,000 for Initial clearing and first follow-up; and $500 for subsequent follow-ups US$500

actual.comment: Target has been achieved for initial weeding (17a) and is still progressing on follow up maintenance with a cost currently at 850 USD per ha (17b).The cost cannot be further decreased due to inflation and higher cost of living.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description:
18. Indicator Dropped
Original formulation was:
% of PAs with no, or poorly, demarcated boundaries
[NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2104]
Indicator dropped as a recommendation from MTR and discussions with the NPCS and Forestry Services.

baseline.comment:
Indicator Dropped
Original formulation was:
At least 95%

target.comment:
Indicator Dropped
Original formulation was:
More than 50%
